intro: Desmos dasymaschalus var. wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan wall lettuce, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy, dark green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a terminal inflorescence, which bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species in the study of high-altitude flora.
